scenario_text.value:
Okay, you’re right. I wasn’t thinking about
how you might feel. I’m sorry, Takuma.

It’s...it’s not your fault, Miyuki.
I’m just...not strong enough for this.

(Man, I feel awful. I can’t even bear to look
at them, see how disappointed they must be.)

Takuma...I never wanted...to have to say
goodbye.
Oh, Agumon! I’m sorry... I am so, so sorry!

It’s okay. I want you to do whatever it is
you want the most, Takuma.

No, it’s not... I wish we could stay
together, too!
But this is goodbye, isn’t it?
Yeah... *sob*
It’s okay, Takuma. Don’t worry.

We’ll find some way to do this. We’ll defeat
the Master, and save the world!

After all, that other world is my home!
We have to do something!
So...you stay safe here, okay, Takuma?
Agu...mon?

Miyuki! Let’s go! We shouldn’t keep the
others waiting!
Yeah, you’re right, Agumon.
So long, Takuma! Take care!

(Hm? Is it just me, or did Agumon’s eyes look
wet?)
(Was he...crying?)
So long, Takuma.
Uh, no, wait!
Agumon... Agumon! AGUMON!!!

(After that, after they were gone, I went
back home to find my mom waiting for me.)

(This whole thing had been a nightmare, and
now I was back where I really belonged.)

(Only, the curry I always used to love never
seemed to taste quite as good as before.)
(And of course...)

(...after they vanished into the light,
I never saw Miyuki or Agumon again.)
